required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective, single-arm, multi-center, pre-market, clinical study designed to provide safety and performance data regarding the use of the Adagio System in the treatment of ventricular tachycardia.
Study subjects will include patients who experience recurrent monomorphic VT and are scheduled for an endocardial VT ablation. Study subjects have or will have an Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) prior to hospital discharge following the cryoablation procedure.
A VT ablation procedure is performed by finding the abnormal ventricular heart tissue that is causing the VT and applying energy with an ablation catheter to the area. The goal is to apply energy to create a scar or destroy the tissue that causes the VT, such that VT is no longer present or inducible.

primary_outcome.measure: An analysis of the proportion of subjects who are free from definite or probable device/procedure related Major Adverse Events (MAEs) that occur during or within 30 days following the cryoablation procedure

An analysis of the proportion of patients receiving a single cryoablation procedure with freedom from ventricular tachycardia lasting longer than 30 seconds after the 3-Month blanking period until the end of the 6 month follow up period.
An analysis of the proportion of subjects with non-inducible monomorphic VT at the conclusion of the initial cryotherapy ablation procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: The proportion of study subjects with probable or definite device or procedure related serious adverse events (SAEs) including MAEs as described above, or serious adverse device effects (SADEs) between 30-days up to 12 months post-procedure.
Performance: The proportion of study subjects with freedom from Ventricular Tachycardia lasting longer than 30 seconds at 12 months without the use of anti-arrhythmic drugs (AADs)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ablation in the ventricle with the Adagio VT cryoablation system

intervention.intervention_name: Ablation in the ventricles with cryoablation
intervention.description: The Adagio Medical VT Cryoablation System is indicated for the treatment of monomorphic ventricular tachycardia by ablation of arrhythmogenic tissue that drives and maintains these arrhythmias
intervention.arm_group_label: Ablation in the ventricle with the Adagio VT cryoablation system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female the ages of â‰¥ 18 years
- Suitable for a catheter ablation due to Ischemic and/or non-ischemic symptomatic monomorphic Ventricular Tachycardia, also monomorphic is defined as a similar QRS configuration from beat to beat.
- Has or will be receiving an ICD prior to hospital discharge post procedure.
- Scheduled for a de novo VT ablation and refractory to at least one AAD, based on physician discretion and hospital standards (Refractory is defined as an AAD not able to treat the arrhythmia satisfactorily or inducing unwanted side effects).
- Subject has LVEF > 20%, confirmed by echo or comparable technique during baseline evaluation
- Willingness, ability, and commitment to participate in baseline and follow-up evaluations for the full length of the study
- Willingness and ability to give an informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- In the opinion of the Investigator, any known contraindication to a ventricular tachycardia ablation, TEE, or anticoagulation, including but not limited to the identification of any cardiac thrombus or evidence of sepsis
- Any duration of continuous arrythmia that is not monomorphic ventricular tachycardia. Multiple mono morphic tachycardia is acceptable, but poly morphic VT is not.
- History of previous ablation or surgical treatment for ventricular tachycardia
- Ventricular tachycardia secondary to electrolyte imbalance, active thyroid disease, or any other reversible or non-cardiac cause
- Structural heart disease as described below:
1. Aortic aneurysm
2. Previous cardiac surgery, ventriculotomy or atriotomy (excluding atriotomy for CABG),
3. Previous cardiac valvular surgical or percutaneous procedure, or prosthetic valve
4. Interatrial baffle, closure device, patch, or PFO occlusion device
5. IVC filter
6. Coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) procedure within six (6) months prior to the ablation procedure
7. Unstable angina or ongoing myocardial ischemia
8. Severe Mitral or Aortic insufficiency or stenosis based on most recent TTE
9. Cardiac myxoma
10. Significant congenital anomaly
11. Recent Myocardial Infarct (MI) or unstable angina, within 60 days prior to the ablation procedure
- Any previous history of cryoglobulinemia
- History of blood clotting or bleeding disease
- Any prior history of documented cerebral vascular accident (CVA), TIA or systemic embolism (excluding a post-operative DVT), within 6 months.
- Pregnant, anticipated during study follow-up
- Current enrollment in any other study protocol where testing or results from that study may interfere with the procedure or outcome measurements for this study
- Any other condition that, in the judgment of the investigator, makes the patient a poor candidate for this procedure, the study or compliance with the protocol (includes vulnerable patient population, mental illness, addictive disease, terminal illness with a minimal life expectancy as it pertains to follow up)
